required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prediction of Outcome in Severe Preeclampsia
clinical_study.official_title: Relation of 3rd Trimester Uterine Artery Doppler Flow Velocimetry Indices, Factor V Leiden Mutation and Placental Pathology to the Severity of Preeclampsia

brief_summary.textblock: this summary studied the predictive values of factor V Leiden mutation , doppler indices , placental pathology to unfavorable fetal and maternal outcomes

detailed_description.textblock: leiden mutation is activated protein C resistance with hypercoagulable states and increased thrombotic risk. 99 % are heterozygous and 1 % is homozygous , very rare cases are psoudohomozygous with factor V deficiency. relation to this mutation was studied in severe preeclamptic patients. doppler indices of uterine arteries , increased pulsetility index or unilateral or bilateral uterine artery notch and placental pathology were studied.

primary_outcome.measure: percentage of patients develop abruption placenta, intrauterine growth retardation or delivered premature
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 12 wks from diagnosis of severe preeclampsia

primary_outcome.measure: percentage of fetuses and neonates complicated with intrauterine fetal death or need admission to incubator
primary_outcome.time_frame: from diagnosis of severe preeclampsia till one week after delivery

intervention.intervention_name: blood sample , doppler of uterine vessel and placenta
intervention.description: blood sample for factor V and doppler examination of uterine arteries , placenta pathology post partum

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant women with preeclampsia in 3rd trimester. Singleton pregnancy. Accurate gestational age confirmed by last menstrual period or sonography before 20 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: severe preeclampsia in 3rd trimester -
Exclusion Criteria:Twin pregnancy. Fetal congenital anomalies. Diabetic patient, impaired renal function. Any medical disorders even that HTN. Any placental pathology,Autoimmune diseases. Women with uterine activity or clinical emergencies with maternal hemodynamic instability or an indication for immediate termination of pregnancy.
-
